Dependency Management Got Awesome CommonJS and AMD Compliant dependency loader for modern web apps

Inject 0.4.1 Available

31 January 2013 • By: Jakob Heuser

Get this release over at the downloads page

Overview

0.4.1 is a feature and bug fix release. All users of Inject running 0.4.0 are encouraged to upgrade.

New Features

  • Introduces the afterFetch pointcut, allowing for mutation of a file before it is executed. This collapses the before/after pointcuts under one umbrella.
  • AMD and Inject Plugins: We can now load plugins with a plugin! prefix, where “plugin” is a supported plugin. We’re launching with text, json, and css. We also support AMD loader plugins
  • Massive push for end-user documentation. Injectjs.com is now live

Dev Changes

  • AMD and CommonJS tests are now external to our repository, reducing the number of tests we need to maintain
  • Analyzer.js is running the Link.JS library internally to improve reliability in dependency detection
  • JSHint file was added to our codebase to improve consistency in coding style
  • Documentation updates and repaired broken examples
  • Travis-CI Reliability Improvements

Tickets From This Release

  • #201, #98 Link.js Upgrade
  • #196 Relative paths do not resolve to correct absolute paths beyond immediate peer
  • #194 “applyRules” doesn’t match regex rules in old versions of Chrome
  • #193, #191, #189, #180 Plugin Support
  • #190, #90 afterFetch pointcut
  • #184 Change Readme and Wiki Docs to be more end-user friendly
  • #183 Improved unit testing with jshint integration
  • #181 Fixes for #177, define regex
  • #179, #175 IE 7/8/9 Test Script for Executor Improvements
  • #177 Error parsing arrays in modules
  • #176 Chrome 13 Bug with Missing Semicolon
  • #174 Error on Examples page
  • #172 When resolving to / shortcut, pointcuts are not stored
  • #165 Examples for how to concatenate files when using Inject
  • #163 A nice and clean way to see exceptions thrown by module files
  • #157 Add CommonJS Tests
  • #146 Investigate non-fatal Syntax errors in Travis-CI

We welcome feedback and discussion on all news items on our Google Groups Mailing List
